intro: Aiolotheca, commonly known as the "sea holly," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Apiaceae. These plants are characterized by their distinctive, often spiny leaves and showy, umbel-like flower clusters. They are typically found in coastal areas and sandy soils, thriving in saline environments. Aiolotheca species are known for their medicinal properties and have been used in traditional herbal remedies. The plant's unique morphology and ecological adaptation make it a notable species in maritime botany.
